result.execSummary:
The defendant Doran M Ware was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs and the remainder to be applied towards 15CM306.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must have no abusive contact with Annie Peterson.
Must complete counseling for anger management or domestic violence.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Good time granted.
Huber granted for work release, work search, counseling and treatment.
Concurrent with: Case Nos. 15CM213 and 15CM224.
Financial obligations have been paid in full.
